Aligned Destinies is a Role-playing Game about characters from different worlds in a common setting, linked by their destinies. In each of those worlds one player plays the lead character while the others join in as supporting crew. And as they proceed through the adventure the world switches by the whim of the GM to throw them into even greater peril or, if they are determined enough, they might switch on their own to lighten their way.

The game is very improvisational and works best if both GM and players actively take part in the creation of the story. It is possible to start playing with only the lead alter-egos created and do the rest of character development on the fly while switching through the worlds of the adventure.

Normally the game is more a one-shot thing, with no greater linking story between adventures. Because of that and with the very light rules included, it is best suited for convention style adventure sessions.

93925.name: Vectrex
93925.description:
The Vectrex was a vector display-based video game console that was developed by Western Technologies/Smith Engineering. It was licensed and distributed first by General Consumer Electric (GCE), and then by Milton Bradley Company after their purchase of GCE. It was released in November 1982 at a retail price of $199 ($440 compensated for inflation); as Milton Bradley took over international marketing the price dropped to $150 and then $100 shortly before the video game crash of 1983. The Vectrex exited the market in early 1984.

Unlike other non-portable video game consoles, which connected to televisions and rendered raster graphics, the Vectrex has an integrated vector monitor which displays vector graphics. The monochrome Vectrex uses plastic screen overlays to generate color and various static graphics and decorations. At the time, many of the most popular arcade games used vector displays, and GCE was looking to set themselves apart from the pack by selling high-quality versions of games such as Space Wars and Armor Attack.

Vectrex comes with a built in game, the Asteroids-like Minestorm, which some claim was reason enough to buy a Vectrex system. Two peripherals were also available for the Vectrex, a light pen and a 3D imager.

The Vectrex was also released in Japan under the name Bandai Vectrex Kousokusen.

While it is a mainstay of disc-based console systems today, the Vectrex was part of the first generation of console systems to feature a boot screen, which also included the Atari 5200 and Colecovision.

Source: Wikipedia, "Vectrex," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93927.name: Handel Ehrlekh
93927.description: Jewish-themed Monoply Clone with an educational message aimed at teaching Torah values to kids.

93928.name: Superfall
93928.description:
User Summary

In this game, you will throw a ragdoll down an obstacle course. You must tilt your iPhone to avoid the many obstacles on the way down, because if your ragdoll stops moving, the game is over.

The game has 30 different ragdolls, 3 stages and more than 40 achievements to collect.

93929.name: Cowboys and Dinosaurs
93929.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Cowboys and Dinosaurs (C&D) is the role playing game of the little told story of the old west and how natives, sheriffs, cowboys, mad scientists and their companions struggled to make a place for themselves. This RPG is written with experienced role players in mind, for the 2011 RPGGeek.com 24 Hour design contest. It assumes a group of 3-6 participants, with one taking the role of Game Master (GM).

The game is played with pencil and paper to record characters, notes and other game developments and a deck of cards participants for resolution of events. Use one deck with 3-4 participants and a double deck if there are 5 or more at the table. The setting is intended to be campy, but gritty. Despite the impressive strength of the dinosaurs, they remain dangerous beasts, not easily tamed.

93930.name: ZauberZeit (Issue 8 - Dec 1987)
93930.description:
(user summary)
table of content:

Interview with S. Coleman Charlton
painting guide
News
Comics
book reviews
Die Quelle des Lebens - universal scenario for multiple rulesets
Die Ratten von Tharbad - MERP scenario
Die Akademie der Magier - MERP location, part 3
Taltanis - Orcland
Drer HügelorK - satirical monster
game reviews

93931.name: ZauberZeit (Issue 9 - Feb/Mar 1988)
93931.description:
(user summary)
table of content

Tanith Lee - portrait
book reviews
News
interview with S. Coleman Charlton, part 2
Bugfol in der Unterwelt - miniature scenario
Das...Gegengift - scenario for DSA
game reviews
Paranoia - the RPG
Cartoons

93932.name: ZauberZeit (Issue 17 - Jun 1989)
93932.description:
(user summary)
table of contents:

News
Die letzte Belohnung - short story by Pratchett
Jack Vance - portrait
book reviews
Das Auge des Theokraten - stormbringer scenario
Alptraumhafte Flitterwochen - scenario in Ommei
Götter, Gräber und Gelehrte - scientists in CoC
game reviews
Kriegfried & Levandell - Comic
Cartoon

93933.name: Boggle
93933.description:
BEAT THE CLOCK! Test your word wit with BOGGLE, the exciting iPhone®/iPod touch® game from EA Mobile. Popping with personality, this pocket-sized version of the classic word-search game packs a lot of punch! Play against the clock in Challenge Mode or modify your time limit in Advanced Mode. Play by your OWN rules in Self-Score Mode! Track challenges and record names, scores & words on a virtual notepad. Collect rewards for your way with words and tap into your iTunes® Library while you play!

Source: The Publisher Website.

93934.name: The Mage Tarot (Revised Edition)
93934.description:
User Summary:

A revised edition of the Mage: The Ascension Tarot (1st Edition), timed to follow the 2000 release of Mage: The Ascension (Revised Edition). Specific differences between the different editions are unclear. Any updates to this entry will be gratefully received.

videogame: Police Quest: In Pursuit of the Death Angel
93935.name: Police Quest Collection
videogamecompilation: Police Quest: In Pursuit of the Death Angel
93935.description:
Back of the box

Relive Gaming History.

Special Limited Edition with 4 products in One box.

It doesn't get more real than this.
POLICE QUEST's four action-packed stories throw you instantly into a cop's daily life. Investigate homicides. Foil drug rings. Track down a serial killer. Former LAPD Chief Daryl Gates is on hand with real-world experience.

93936.name: Terrorist Zombies
93936.description:
Terrorist Zombies is a post-apocalyptic third-person shooter for iPhone, iPod touch, and iPad. In the war-ravaged future, terrorists have resorted to injecting themselves with an experimental neurotoxin that turns humans into ticking time-bomb-toting zombies. Waves of the infected horde are threatening the last bastion of humanity, and after a hair-raising heli-drop, players must take up post as the lone Marine responsible for securing and defending the area against total zombie domination.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93937.name: Scorcher
93937.description:
Game box

The fastest, most technically advanced racing action ever!

Enter the underworld of New York City, where fierce clans of warriors undergo deadly surgical procedures, turning themselves into half machines called Vexoids. Screaming through a white-knuckled world of shadows and danger, you must pit your racing skills against a pack of high speed rivals in a race to the death!

93938.name: Puckerz!
93938.description:
Puckerz! is a new and wonderful arcade game of skill and timing currently in development for the iPhone and iPod Touch. Collect as many orbs as you can using your Puck of choice before time runs out. Bounce off walls and blocks and break bricks while you’re at it in this truly unique game.

Touch, drag, and release your Puck to launch it and play with 30 levels featuring different sets of challenges. If you’re up for it, grab the power token provided in each level to help you Puck your way through.

Do you have what it takes to become a Master Pucker?

Source: The Game Website.

93939.name: Jagged Alliance 2: Gold Pack
93939.description:
Jagged Alliance 2: Gold Pack was published by Strategy First on August 6, 2002 and adds the improvements of Unfinished Business to the final release of Jagged Alliance 2. The Unfinished Business and a scenario editor are also included in the package.

Gold Pack introduces notable changes to the difficulty setting. The player choosing an advanced difficulty level may also decide to make the player turns timed and whether to disallow saving during combat, as opposed to the original Jagged Alliance 2, which set these settings automatically.

As of July 2006 it is available via the Steam content delivery system, as well as Turner Broadcasting's GameTap. This version has a bug which causes the player to have infinite money rendering financial strategy irrelevant. Unfinished Business contains a bug which results in the player being unable to save his or her progress. Strategy First has acknowledged the issues but has failed to provide a fix.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jagged Alliance 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93940.name: Al Shir-Ma
93940.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Deep within the sifting sands, Al Shir-Ma was the Sultan's great prize, an oasis for the parched, a refuge for the desperate and a blessing for the devout. Since time immemorial the town’s great fountain spilled fine, clear water for all. The people of Al Shir-Ma were wealthy, trading marvellous treasures with the great caravans and bartering lost secrets and mysteries with the fierce desert tribes. Merchants, scholars, magicians and nobles; all were welcome in Al Shir-Ma.

It is said that it was not the Sultan’s protection, nor the wealth of the Merchant Princes that made Al Shir-Ma great, but the very masters of the desert, the mighty Djinni themselves, who walked the streets and worked great magics upon the town.

Why did the Djinni do such things? Who can say? Perhaps they had dwelt in the town before the people arrived. Perhaps they had struck a bargain with the Sultan, for many whispered that they lived amongst the people as any citizen might, or, perhaps they were waiting for something beyond mortal comprehension.

What is known, is that a great calamity was visited upon Al Shir-Ma. One fateful day the great fountain in the town square stopped flowing and the people of the town were struck by one tragedy after another. They faced their greatest trial, and they did so alone, for the Djinni had disappeared.

But, of course, our tale is just beginning...

93941.name: Doodle Truck
93941.description:
User Summary

Load up with supplies and then make a beeline for the drop off location all while trying not to lose anything. Your route is typically full of hills, keeping everything in the truck bed is easier said than done.

Available as a standalone title or as part of Triniti's Gamebox 2.

videogame: IL-2 Sturmovik: Forgotten Battles: Ace Expansion Pack
93942.name: IL-2 Sturmovik Series: Complete Edition
videogamecompilation: IL-2 Sturmovik: Forgotten Battles: Ace Expansion Pack
93942.description:
Game box

The most critically acclaimed flight simulator series is now merged into one DVD including: Il-2 Sturmovik Forgotten Battles, the Ace Expansion Pack, Pacific Fighters, and all the intermediary add-ons.

This epic collection of WWWII air combat spans the entire globe, from the sands of Iwo Jima to the snow-covered steppes of Russia. Fly P-51s over the Ardennes, Wildcats over Guadalcanal, FW-109s over D-Day beaches, or Yaks over Stalingrad: the possibilities are endless!

93943.name: Syndicate Plus
93943.description:
Game box

This superb action strategy game from Bullfrog, includes Syndicate AND The American Revolt on one CD.

In the dark and twisted cities of tomorrow, corporate syndicates compete for global dominance. But in the future there are no more board room deals, no corporate take-overs, no politics- just the dreadful justice of a gun toting machine who knows no remorse.

Control your team of Cyborgs
Compete with 8 other syndicates for control of over 50 territories.
Construct and arm your cyborg agents.
Living cities with their own infrastructure, police force & transport system.
Stunning sound effects, and action sensitive music.

The American Revolt delivers you 21 new missions and 10 specially designed multiplayer missions. Network support for 2-8 players. New equipment to CRUSH the enemy.

93944.name: Piggy Woogy
93944.description:
Stop the wolves to save your lover from Woogy's rush!

Move blocks to stop the climbing wolves on the wall of the castle. Use the special items to clear blocks or hold back the wolves. A variety of castles and many dangerous wolves are awaiting your challenge.

Source: The Game Website.

93945.name: Syndicate American Revolt
93945.description:
Syndicate: American Revolt is an expansion set designed for the Bullfrog strategy game Syndicate. During the game, the player leads a four-man team of cyborgs through the streets of a dark, dystopian world and through 21 difficult missions.

The game takes place during the 22nd century, after the events of Syndicate. The entire world is controlled by a mega-corporation called Eurocorp. The company has become extremely wealthy and powerful after inventing the CHIP, which is a cybernetic implant capable of altering the perceptions of human beings so that the reality of a dystopia is perceived as a utopia.

The citizens of North and South America, tired of high taxes and dangerous streets, are rebelling against Eurocorp control to regain their autonomy. Rival Syndicates are using the revolt as the ideal opportunity to gain the upper hand in the ongoing struggle for supremacy. The player takes the role of a Eurocorp Syndicate executive, and the main objective of the game is to stop a massive revolt in the Americas that threatens the very existence of Eurocorp.

Source: Wikipedia, "Syndicate: American Revolt", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93946.name: RoboSockets
93946.description:
RoboSockets is a fascinating arcade-puzzle with a unique combination of tetris, pipes and match 3 mechanics. Thought-out world of lively characters with their history, legends and heroes makes it addictive and engaging as no other casual game on the platform.

RoboPlanet lies in ruins left without electricity by a short circuit and desperately needs a tiny human intervention to plug in sockets of helpless robots. Direct robots to connect to each other with their hands/sockets and create a chain of 5 or more robots. Each chain gives you energy needed to restore the planet’s functionality and revive the RoboCivilization. Diversity of robo-characters, smooth learning curve and unique bonus features make RoboSockets a perfect brain trainer. Simple idea, several modes to challenge yourself in, elaborate design, sounds and storyline make it pick-up-and-play and addictive. It’s as simple as genius and brings a breath of fresh air to the tried bejeweled-type games.

Source: The Game Website.

93947.name: Vikings Can Fly!
93947.description:
In Vikings Can Fly! you play as Bjorn, a young viking inventor with an incredible passion for women and a laboratory full of weird machineries.He actually never created something really useful to his people because he is always too busy running after young ladies.

A few days ago he casually met a valkyrie that was bathing by a waterfall and he suddenly fell in love. She obviously ran away; leaving a sweet perfume trail along her path. His dream is to find her back all the way through the nine worlds of the Norse Gods.

Will he be able to use his genius this time?

Source: The Developer Website.

93948.name: Puppet War:FPS
93948.description:
Puppet War is a fully 3d, totally crazy, action packed hilarious FPS ( First 'Puppet' Shooter ) game for the iPhone.
You play a janitor who has to battle hordes of evil cuddly puppets that want to take over the world! All this in a freaky
colorful tv studio with extremely lethal weapons!

Source: The Game Website.

93949.name: Fantastical Currencies: Kingdom Edition Master Set #1
93949.description:
From the Introduction:

This Master Set includes a set of realistic currency that might exist in a fantasy kingdom. We strive to make our product both generic and unique to provide versatile game play. This set depicts kings, queens, knights, castles, and all other royal goodness. Enjoy.

What do you get with Layers?

A quick presentation of the features found in this product and what you can do with them for your own game.

The Layers function gives you more control then ever!

Turn on/off money names and choose different currency values.
Use one template for front, the other for the back for double sided.
Change and swap many different face images.
Choose from colored templates or keep it B&W and print on colored paper.
Tons of options and variety!

93950.name: Reiner Knizia's Labyrinth
93950.description:
Labyrinth is the latest addictive puzzle from the legendary game designer, Dr. Reiner Knizia. You take the role of a hero venturing deep into the earth in search of unknown treasures. Along the way you must face both danger and opportunity.

Can you find the way through the labyrinth to the hidden riches deep inside the mountain? Will you be able to defeat the dragons guarding the treasure?

The game mechanics are very simple, but incredibly addictive. You build a labyrinth by dragging tiles into a 4x4 grid and rotating them into place.

Your objectives while building the labyrinth are:

1. Get through the labyrinth to the upper side
2. Avoid the monsters
3. Collect swords that let you deal with the monsters
4. Collect treasures on the way. The game is divided into 3 scenarios.

You start off in the Hedge Maze, with the basic game as described above. When you have completed all levels of the Hedge Maze, you proceed into the Castle Ruins. This scenario is haunted by ghosts who randomly block tiles and make it harder for you to find your way out. The third scenario is in the Dungeons, and really quite hard to get through.

Source: The Developer Website.

93951.name: SpikeDislike
93951.description:
Spike Dislike is a wonderfully retro jumping game.

The rules are simple. You must dislike the spikes!

Hold down the right side of the screen, and your little ball will travel towards the right.

It'll keep jumping upwards, so your only task is to move to the right, to avoid any upcoming spikes.

Source: The Developer Website.

93952.name: Tiny Wings
videogamehonor: 2012 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
93952.description:
You have always dreamed of flying - but your wings are tiny. Luckily the world is full of beatiful hills. Use the hills as jumps - slide down, flap your wings and fly! At least for a moment - until this annoying gravity brings you back down to earth. But the next hill is waiting for you already. Watch out for the night and fly as fast as you can. Otherwise flying will only be a dream once again.

Highlights:

simple but skillfull "one button" arcade game about the dream of flying
the world is changing every day - so it does in this game! Procedural generated graphics will make "tiny wings" look different every day you play
upgrade your nest by fulfilling tasks
every big jump over the ocean will bring you to new adventures on a new island
runs smoothly at 60fps even on older devices
OpenFeint enabled with 27 tricky achievements
cloudtouches for everyone




Source: The Developer Website.

93953.name: Bad Air Day
93953.description:
User Summary

You are an elevator operator with a bad case of gas. Prevent your "outbreaks" from affecting your riders -- or else get fired!

93954.name: Volcano Escape
93954.description:
Introducing Colonel Charlie Bravo, decorated war veteran and all around hero! Charlie recently disappeared whilst taking his summer vacation, only to resurface as a sacrificial offering to appease the lava gods!

Jet packs, grenade launchers, and shotguns are just a few pieces of the arsenal you will need to escape alive. This action platformer takes you on a vacation-turned-nightmare as you try to climb out of the volcano and destroy the tribal minions hell bent on sacrificing you to the volcano god. In Volcano Escape you get one life to climb as high as you can while escaping from the rising tide of lava and blasting volcano demons along the away. In a unique gameplay twist the minions turn into solid rock when shot and form the platforms on which to leap to your escape. Mess up, however, and you are toast!

Volcano Escape provides Game Center support, allowing players to post high scores and compete on the leaderboards. Players can also submit scores on Facebook and Twitter to show off their escape artistry to friends and followers. iPhone 4 users can also enjoy Retina Display support for gorgeous 3D gameplay. With achievements, upgrades and 5 unlockable characters, some with in app purchases up for grabs, players must continue to run, jump, shoot, or burn!

Source: The Developer Website.

93955.description:
From the Front Cover:

¡The Dice Game of Mexican Wrestling!

For 1 or more players!
Play for hours, or just a few minutes!
Customize characters with your own one of a kind Luchador Mask designs!





User Summary:

A match is played between two or more characters who are defined by three attributes:

Strength that starts at two dice
Agility that starts at two dice
Stamina that starts at 12




A character also has an additional die that is placed in either Strength or Agility.

Each round, players choose to roll either their character's Strength or Agility, with the higher score winning, and the loser subtracting the difference from their Stamina. Rolling doubles explodes the dice (roll the doubles again and add to the previous roll). Any rolls of 6 automatically cause 1 point of damage to their opponent's Stamina.


If a round was won using Strength, any character reduced to zero or less Stamina loses and is out; if all characters have no Stamina, the match is a draw.
If a round was won using Agility, the winning character has pinned the losing character. Pinning a character for three consecutive rounds will cause that character to lose.


At the end of each match, players can increase their character's stats using Glory Points (1 GP is gained for each point scored in their rolls, and an additional 100 GP goes to the winner of a match). Buying an additional Strength or Agility die costs the current number of dice x 100 GP (each additional die bought also adds 5 Stamina).

There are additional rules for using teams, weapons, and stunning. The game includes a worked example, pre-made characters, and blank character cards.
93955.name: ¡Uncle Cucuy's Lucha Libre!

93956.name: Full Deck Solitaire
93956.description:
User Summary

22 solitaire card games, by the developer of 7th Guest and his family.

93957.name: Falling Fred
93957.description:
Insane Falling Survival Action!

Lead Fred in his futile exercise to avoid the inevitable - becoming a human slice of minced meat. Dodge obstacles, avoid limb damage when possible but remember to keep your head attached to your shoulders (and without smashing it too much), or it's the end of the trip for you.

Source: The Developer Website.

93958.name: Zombie Runaway
93958.description:
Zombie's Breathtaking Rush!

Still scared of zombies? Play with our freakishly cute Zombie on his last runaway to prove that you're not!

In Zombie Runaway, keep our cutie Zombie away from humans by dodging, jumping, and crushing tombstones in the moonlit cemetery.

Simply Jump or move from Left to Right....All done with 3 touch buttons!

Have a ride on Boosters to crash through tombstones and watch Zombie run faster with smooth and easy control.

Invincible once on a Booster! Crush tombstones and obstacles in Zombie's way with more exciting fun.

Source: The Developer Website.

93959.name: The Free Musketeers
93959.description:
From the Back Cover:

Amid the swash and buckle...
...become a Hero!

Lords and ladies play politics in the corridors of power, where a misspoken word means life or death. Revel in the intrigue that gives the world of Untamed Empires its name.

This Adventure Toolkit contains details of life among the imperial courts, offers 75 additional feats (including three new supernatural professions), and includes a complete adventure for 250K characters that explores the murkiest of schemes inside the holy Church of Napri.

For for all, and all for fun!


From the Introduction:

What is The Free Musketeers?

The Free Musketeers is a roleplaying supplement, the third installment in the Untamed Empires setting series. It's designed to show you the countries, governments, and people of the New World continent so that you can create stories and adventures there. You'll find world information (Section One), an entire adventure (Section Two) and 75 new feats to play with (Section Three).

This book fits in with the other Untamed Empires supplements, but it can also be played solo with just the main Suzerain book for rules. Free free to cherry-pick sections and ideas, as well. It's your world now!

rpgseries: The Rituals of Choice Adventure Path
93960.name: To Kill or Not To Kill
93960.description:
From the Introduction:

When the PCs arrive in Far-Rough, they discover that the town is suffering from a rash of deaths caused by a murderous grave-talon. The locals are terrified and believe the rune animal Solange has abandoned the region. Compounding the issue is a group of nobles who are secretly hunting the gravetalons of the Floating Forest. The townsfolk, no longer trusting their local catchpole (sheriff), are now pressuring him to seek outside assistance. So begins To Kill or Not To Kill.


Grave-talon is the name the people of Far-Rough have given the Dinosaur: Deinonychus


"To Kill or Not To Kill" is an Arcana Evolved adventure designed for four 2nd-level characters. Characters will advance to 3rd level by the end of the adventure. This is the second installment in the Rituals of Choice Adventure Path, a complete campaign saga consisting of 25 adventures.

The entire campaign path will take characters from a simple escort mission at 1st level to an apocalyptic battle for the universe at 25th level. The campaign is episodic with individual adventures able to stand alone despite a plot arc that runs through the entire series. This full arc will become clearer with each episode, together with "The Player's Guide to The Rituals of Choice Adventure Path," and "The Path Chosen" web enhancements that you can find at our website, www.ritepublishing.com.

Campaign Setting

The Rituals of Choice Adventure Path takes place in the Lands of the Diamond Throne setting but is flexible enough to work equally well in other Arcana Evolved or d20 hybrid settings. You could easily move "To Kill or Not To Kill" to another town where grave-talons could possibly hunt nearby.

Preparation

To play the Rituals of Choice Adventure Path, you will need a copy of Monte Cook's Arcana Evolved: A Variant Player's Handbook, Core Rule Books II and III. A number of monsters and NPCs will be drawn from Legacy of the Dragons so this will also be very helpful. However if you do not have this book, full stat blocks are already provided. Owning and/or playing the first part, "A Witch's Choice," is helpful but not necessary, as the player handout "What Has Gone Before," included with this adventure, has all the information the GM and players might need.

93961.name: Rally Ho!
93961.description:
Trivia games about RV (Recreational vehicle) lifestyle.
Rally Ho! challenges participants to correctly answer trivia questions and rewards the correct answer with the right to roll the dice and move their RV forward!
Trivia questions are grouped in 4 categories; RV Travel, The RV Lifestyle, The Great Outdoors, and American Nostalgia.
The more knowledge they have about America, travel and the RV lifestyle, the faster they'll reach the rally site and win!

Components:

game board,
360 question cards in 4 categories,
36 Road Hazard cards,
20 Road Rescue cards,
4 mini RVs,
1 timer,
2 dice

93962.name: Dragons at Dawn
93962.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to Dave Arnesons Basement! It's 1971 and you've been invited to play this cool new game... Dragons at Dawn is a retro tribute to the very first fantasy gaming system pioneered by Dave Arneson, the man who later went on to co-author the worlds most popular roleplaying game. The result of years of careful historical research, Dragons at Dawn is entirely consistent with Arneson's original, largely forgotten methods of play developed in 1970-1973.

93963.name: Arcane Kingdoms: Seven Realms Beyond the Horizon
93963.description:
From the Introduction:

Across the seas or perhaps trackless deserts, places of legend in stories told by sailors who have seen the edges of the world, these Arcane Kingdoms are beyond the knowledge of many. But here, collected in these pages, is all the information known of these realms.

For now.

When adventurers find these lands, they may add new understandings, upset accept wisdom, and possibly even forge a new history for these dominions.

What Do I Do With This?

Whatever you want.

The purpose of Arcane Kingdoms is to provide a small amount of information on a collection of nations that could be used in your game. How these are used depend on what you need. If you are running a "points of light" campaign, your players' characters may find themselves near the edge of the map, and begin asking what's beyond that. You may need a background for a mysterious character, some place beyond the confines already known in your campaign. One of your players may want a character who likewise comes from beyond the known lands.

Basically, this saves you from thinking up some foreign lands, for whatever purpose they might be needed.

93965.name: Trivial Pursuit Junior Fifth Edition
93965.description: In the fifth edition of Trivial Pursuit Junior players roll dice and move around the board answering questions in six categories. As with other Trivial Pursuit games, the board spaces are a wheel with spokes, and the spaces are color-coded to trivia categories. The goal of the game is to answer a question in each of the six categories on the "pie space", and then return to the center of the board to answer a final question and win.

93967.name: Vendetta
93967.description:
Vendetta is a chess variant for four players. The game is not very original - very similar games like 4 handed chess exist already since a long time.

Vendetta is played on a cross shaped board: attached to each of the four sides of a standard 8x8 chess board there are four 4x8 parts.
The final board has a 192 squares, differently from most 4-way chess sets which have only 160 squares, as the additional parts of the board are only 3x8.

Here, queens start the game always on black squares. The rules suggest to play in two teams of two, or each player for itself, but do not mention what the conditions to win are.

The pieces, colored white, black, blue and red are hollow and should be filled with sand.
On the reverse side of the board, a normal chess board is printed.

The box tells that
The game is copyrighted by J. Deak, Ewing, N.J. 08638, U.S.A. U.S.A. patent No: 4,778,87.

Made in Holland. Marketed By: Bonne Nuit, Inc. 743 Alexander Road Princeton, N.J. 08540 U.S.A. Tele: 609-987-1269, Fax: 609-520-1350.

93969.name: Battle Command
93969.description:
Battle Command is a futuristic 3D tank simulation game released by Ocean in 1990. It was written by Realtime Games and is a development of their successful title Carrier Command.

In some unknown time in the future, armies of tanks battle for supremacy as the Ultra War rages between the two dominant races in the New World.

The player takes control of a single "Mauler" assault tank in a series of combat missions against other armoured vehicles and stationary targets.

Unlike Carrier Command which incorporated significant strategic elements, Battle Command is a simple arcade game reminiscent of Battlezone.

The player views the battle from the forward perspective of the tank. As with Battlezone, the turret is fixed and cannot be rotated or elevated. However the playing area is flat and shells travel in long horizontal trajectories, so to aim the gun the tank is simply rotated left or right.

The player may equip their tank with a variety of weapons, the choice of which will depend on the nature of the mission. The Helicarrier will then drop the tank into the combat zone to carry out its objectives. On successful completion of the mission the Helicarrier will retrieve the Mauler and carry it to safety.

There are ten missions in all to complete.
Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Command_%28video_game%29...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93970.name: Microscope
rpghonor: 2011 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
2011 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
2011 Indie RPG Award - Most Innovative Game - Runner-Up
2012 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
93970.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What is Microscope?

Humanity spreads to the stars and forges a galactic civilization...

Fledgling nations arise from the ruins of the empire...

An ancient line of dragon-kings dies out as magic fades from the realm...

These are all examples of Microscope games. Want to explore an epic history of your own creation, hundreds or thousands of years long, all in an afternoon? That's Microscope.

You won't play the game in chronological order. You can defy the limits of time and space, jumping backward or forward to explore the parts of the history that interest you. Want to leap a thousand years into the future and see how an institution shaped society? Want to jump back to the childhood of the king you just saw assassinated and find out what made him such a hated ruler? That’s normal in Microscope.

You have vast power to create... and to destroy. Build beautiful, tranquil jewels of civilization and then consume them with nuclear fire. Zoom out to watch the majestic tide of history wash across empires, then zoom in and explore the lives of the people who endured it.


Mock chronological order.
Defy time and space.
Build worlds and destroy them.


A role-playing game for two to four players. No GM. No prep.
rpgpodcastepisode: Microscope – The Rise and Fall of the Monster King
The Voice of the Revolution #52: March 2011 -- Geasa review & Epidiah Ravachol Interview
The Voice of the Revolution #53: April 2011 -- Microscope review & Rob Donoghue Interview

93971.description:
Nile DeLuxor is a reprint of the card game Nile that includes a new expansion in the box. The expansion adds several new cards including two new crop types, monuments, and turn counter cards. The number of players is also expanded to allow for as many as 6.

Nile DeLuxor is available as a published version and a print and play edition through Minion games. The published version is a complete game that includes original Nile and the expansion.
boardgameversion: English First Print and Play Edition
93971.name: Nile DeLuxor

93972.name: Crossroads: The Accident Prevention Game
93972.description:
Crossroads is a children's game. The aim is to be the first to move your token from your start space to the home space. Dotted around the board are hazards which cause you to return to your start space. The hazards include crashes, visiting the police station or visiting the hospital. Movement is carried out by means of drawing cards and moving according to the instructions on the card which are a direction and distance. In this manner, players must plan a route which does not hit a hazard or a dead end. If a player is unable to move their token, they must return to their start space and discard their hand of cards.

From the box: "An exciting and hazardous racing game for 2 to 6 younger players"

93973.name: GermCraft
93973.description:
Dr. Mad

He suffers from a terrible curse. When the moon is full, all the men in the Mad family transform into a dog....

He is no exception.

He has devoted his life to researching the Mad family curse, and has found a germ called MOMO that he believes will end the curse. He's now experimenting with MOMO and other germs to find the cure.

Source: The Developer Website.

93974.name: Teddy Bears Picnic
93974.description: Teddy Bears Picnic is a roll-and-move children's game. Players must move their teddy bear playing piece around the board collecting items for a picnic. The first player to collect four different snacks and return to the centre of the board is the winner.

93975.name: Children of the Worm
93975.description:
From the publisher:

Children of the Worm is a downloadable adventure for The Chronicles of Future Earth, set in the city of Korudav. It deals with a strange alliance between a clan of Troglodytes and a gang of bandit Che Kwa, the red men of Kadram, the havoc they’re wreaking and the secret they’ve uncovered.

The book is divided into five parts: the first two are the scenario episodes "Obnoxious Jin’s Boatyard", a well-known inn along Korudav’s Grand Canal, and "The House of the White Sepulcher", a run-down manse in the precincts. The last three parts provide details on the Troglodytes (also known as P’Tek, or Maggot Men), and their goddess Durgha the Dark Mother, who the Autocracy knows as Babisiya.

93976.name: Federation of Free Traders
93976.description:
User Summary
Federation Of Free Traders (also called F.O.F.T or Federation) is a space exploration game released in 1989 by Gremlin Graphics on Atari ST and Amiga. Inspired by Elite, the player travels in between planets using a spaceship outfitted with various armaments and cargo.

Introduction from the game:
FOFT is a space simulation developed over 24 months by Paul Blythe for Gremlin Graphics. Featuring filled 3D graphics, professionally composed music and excellent graphics. The game includes over 8 million planets to visit in a play area approximately 10-34 metres across (18 trillion light years). With variable weapons systems, a real shipboard computer with its own basic-like language, navigation systems, a sophisticated communication system that lets you talk with other ships, trading and fighting missions. FOFT is the nearest thing to real space flight on a home computer.

93977.name: Fanorona
93977.description:
Fanorona is a traditional game from Madagascar, played on a 9x5 board. It's not just a rectangular grid like chess; the spaces are connected by lines. Pieces may move only along the lines. Notice that not all spaces which seem to be adjacent diagonally are actually connected. This turns out to be important for strategy: a piece can, in essence, hide from another piece, yet stay nearby.

Pieces may move only along the lines, one step at a time.

Capture is by approach or withdrawal. In other words, to capture a piece, you either move into place to be adjacent to it (i.e., so that, if you moved one more step in the same direction, you would be on top of it), or else start out adjacent to it and move away from it (so that, if you had moved in the opposite direction, you would be on top of it). A piece may not capture both by approach and by withdrawal in the same move; the player must choose.

When you capture, you're actually capturing a line of pieces, not just one: all the opponent pieces in the same direction, up until a blank space or one of your pieces.

After each capture, if the same piece can make another capture, it must, provided it is changing direction, and provided it does not cross back on its path (within the same turn, that is).

If you can make a capture, you must.

The game is over when all of one player's pieces are gone, or when one player cannot move.

Source: The Developer Website.

93978.name: Out of The Violent Planet
93978.description:
Designer's description:

This mini-setting takes present-day Earth and posits its discovery by alien empires whose typical diplomatic style is to use telepathy to break new races into brain-synched slavery. They have no idea how to deal with an independent and psi-blind species that has spoken language and gunpowder weapons. Does tragedy ensue, or comedy? That"s up to your players and their rag-tag group of gundaddies, criminal psychics and rogue xenthropologists.

93979.name: Diception
boardgamepublisher: Four Clowns Game & Toy Co, LLC
93979.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Welcome to the crazy, fast-paced, fun-for-the-whole-family world of Diception! A board game that takes less than two minutes to learn and a lifetime to master! It requires no special skills or abilities, but be cautioned, you never quite know who is bluffing and who is playing it straight!

Diception is similar to liar’s dice but adds a few twists of its own making it the perfect fun-for-the-whole-family board game! The included instruction booklet contains multiple different ways to play ensuring you will never get bored!

The strategy from person to person and hand to hand changes each time a new bid is made! Guess wrong and you lose a die, guess right and your opponent must surrender one of their precious cubes!

But wait, there is a a twist! Roll the Second Chance Cube, it could change your fortunes or maybe even the fortunes of the entire table!

To win and be crowned the Diceptor, be the last person still holding dice!

Diception is fast to play! An entire game can be played in as little as ten minutes making it the perfect play anytime anywhere board game! But it is so much fun to play you just might wind up playing for hours!

Each Diception board game comes with 20 dice, a Second Chance Cube, four high quality genuine leather tumblers, instruction booklet that reveals multiple different ways to play, and a convenient and durable carrying case, complete with carrying strap!"

93980.name: The Nobleman's Daughter
93980.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventure takes place in the city of Heigenchou, as the ninja seek out a missing girl in the hopes of keeping a nobleman loyal to the Lotus Coalition. It mixes action, investigation and stealth together to give players a rollercoaster of a time.

Included:

Full Adventure
10 Pregenerated characters (so players can jump RIGHT into the game)
Combat Cheat Sheet (all Actions, Reaction and Modifiers on 1 sheet)
Combat Tracker

93981.name: Mr. Karoshi
93981.description:
We've been taught we need to survive. We need to reach the end, save the princess and be the hero. That's all well and good, but it's getting boring. Who says it has to be this way?

Mr Karoshi is an overworked Japanese salaryman who’s had enough and his only goal is to end it all. You control him to work through the fast logic puzzles trying to find hilarious ways to his demise in this highly original, puzzle, platformer with a twist.

It’s not as easy as it sounds!! You need to think cleverly and sometimes ‘outside the box’ to find a solution. Forget everything you know so far!

Source: The Developer Website.

93982.name: Joe Montana Football
93982.description:
As part of the marketing of the new Sega Genesis, Sega of America president and CEO Michael Katz planned to create a library of instantly-recognizable titles for the console by contracting with celebrities and athletes to produce games using their names and likenesses. As part of this, Sega signed a US$1.7 million five-year contract with Joe Montana, despite concerns among the Japanese executives that the game would not earn enough to cover this cost.

Since Sega of America did not at the time have a large game production facility and Sega of Japan had never designed a football game, Sega contracted with Mediagenic to develop the game for November 1989. No one at Sega was aware of the turmoil inside Mediagenic at the time; despite five months of reports that development was proceeding on schedule, Katz discovered in September or October that the game was hardly begun. To have a football game for Christmas release, Sega would have to find an already-completed game that could be converted.

Sega approached Electronic Arts, developer of the Madden NFL series, and president Trip Hawkins agreed to help. Joe Montana Football missed the Christmas deadline and was released in January 1991, shortly after the Genesis version of John Madden Football

Source: Wikipedia, "Joe Montana Football", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93983.name: Kung Fu Kid
93983.description:
Kung Fu Kid is a Sega Master System video game about a kid that has knowledge of kung fu (including the fascinating art of wall jumping). This action game tests his skills as he defeats terrible enemies in order to save the day. It was released for the Sega Mark III in Japan as 魔界列伝 (Makai Retsuden?).

Source: Wikipedia, "Kung Fu Kid", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93984.name: Sexopoly
93984.description:
Product Description
Sexopoly is a new adult board game of strategy, luck, intimacy and fun! Designed to be played with your partner and/or VERY good friends - for everyone who enjoys intimate and sexy games. Each throw of the dice will move you around the board and by using Sexopoly money (notes) you will purchase businesses and aim to make the most profit within the adult industry. The Risky or Frisky cards will help and hinder your progress, the cards will try to relieve you of your money, clothes & inhibitions and even tempt you with more riches by having you perform sexy challenges (or not - it's up to you)!

Each game includes the following contents: 1 Playing Board, 8 Playing Pieces, Sexopoly Notes (money), 100 Risky or Frisky Questions, 100 Trivia Questions, 28 Ownership Cards, 2 Dice & 1 Rules sheet.

93985.name: Wordplay Family Edition
93985.description:
Product Description
If you love word games...get ready for WORDPLAY. It's fast-paced, challenging, and easy to learn - and everyone plays every round! The spinner determines the letters and category for each round. For instance, the category might be "Food & Drink", and you may be looking for words that begin with a 'P' and contain an 'A' - 'Pizza' and 'Pasta' may come to mind, or maybe 'Pancakes' and 'Peaches'. What about "Places" that start with a 'B' and contain an 'N'? You may think of 'Boston' or 'Birmingham'. If you can't think of any "Places" with those letters, you can still score points - just fewer - by coming up with words outside the category, like 'Banjo', 'Bargain', etc. You get the picture. There are different ways to score points, and the more points you score the more spaces you advance on the board. Every round provides a whole new challenge, and there are countless possible combinations to wrap your mind around. WORDPLAY is addictive fun that will make your head spin!

93986.name: The Witch's Brew
93986.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The Witch's Brew mixes together a cauldron full of feats and builds to create a witch character for Pathfinder Roleplaying Game that evokes the awe and dread of medieval folklore.

Created by Sigfried Trent, this 14-page book includes:


A breakdown of the Witch class
30 new feats for witches including Craft Magic Tattoo, Usurp Spell and Familiar Reincarnation
Witch character builds: arch-witch, white witch and wicked Witch!


Teach your enemies not to trifle with powers beyond their comprehension: get your copy of Advanced Feats: The Witch's Brew today!

93987.name: The Mastermind Affair
93987.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Adamant Entertainment presents another pulse-pounding adventure for ICONS: Superpowered Roleplaying!

A diabolical contest is underway, and the unwitting heroes are all that stand between the villains and the ultimate prize! Can the heroes withstand being drawn into... The Mastermind Affair?

93988.name: Combat Essentials 1: Critical Matters
93988.description:
From the Back Cover:

Illirian stood, his sword shaking in his left hand. His vision blurred and his right arm - his sword arm - hung broken and twisted. Blood ran down the limb, pooling below him. He took a step forward and waves of dizziness rose within him from the blood loss and the pain.

This was supposed to be an easy battle. One minute and this ridiculous, self-appointed hero would be dead. It should have been over before it began... but one lucky shot. One lucky shot and it all came down around him.

"Your reign of terror is over," the boy said. So typical.

"Shut up." Illirian raised his sword in his off hand. The boy had gotten lucky. Maybe luck would run both ways...


Critical Matters is a Critical Effects product. In these pages, you will find more than seventeen hundred unique Critical Effects. Some of them are funny. Some of them are brutal. They are all more interesting than simple Damage. With these Critical Effects characters can be Stunned, receive Permanent injuries, or even be killed outright.

This product adds excitement to any game. It makes combat more dangerous and evocative. With it, the underdog can win. With more than one hundred results for each Damage Type, this book will give you years of gaming enjoyment.

93990.name: World War II
93990.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

WWII is not a very detailed game, nor was it ever meant to be that way. What I've tried to create is a system which allows for easy conversion from any of the published games out there. At low attribute levels the game is rather deadly, while high-level characters can do some very cinematic things and survive. But whatever the power level, there is not much bookkeeping, even for vehicles. West End Games' STAR WARS RPG is complex compared to this.

WWII is based on my generic science fiction RPG known as WAR. This version incorporates all of the refinements made after the initial release of the original rules. There are also some additions, which were not included in the last released version (1.3). Some things have been left out because they do not belong in a WWII game. This file does not include equipment or vehicle lists. They will be available separately.

93991.name: Tiddlytennis
93991.description:
Tiddly Winks played on a felt tennis mat with a "net" made of wood between the ends. A plastic disk is pressed against a second plastic disk to propel second plastic disk over a net. If you miss, your opponent scores a point.

Repeat.

93992.name: Blue Heat: The Case of the Cover Girl Murders
93992.description:
User Summary
Blue Heat is based on the 1995 movie Cover Me, Blue Heat. It is a detective game put together using photos and videos of actors and actresses of the time.

As Holly Jacobson, a detective in the Los Angeles Police Department, the player goes under cover in order to stop an elusive serial killer, whose interest lies in the workers at LA Erotica Magazine. In a first person mode, evidence must be collected by talking with characters, visiting important locations, and receiving tips via PDA. Multiple endings are possible and are dependent on the player's actions within the game.

93994.name: Bubble Explode
93994.description:
We celebrate arrival of our first game Bubble Explode to the App Store by giving it away for FREE!

Take your Bubble Exploding / Popping / Breaking experience to the next level with nice animations, bonuses, global online scoreboards, original game modes and much more!

Features:

Chain reaction bubble Explosions
3 game modes: Classic, Chill Out and Bubble Invasion
Slick animations
Bonuses for exploding bubble groups of nice shapes: squares, lines, corners, etc.
Global online scoreboards
Undo up to 10 moves back
Colored and Black & White skins included

Source: The Developer Website.

93995.name: iCopter Free
93995.description:
User Summary

In this game you pilot a helicopter through a cave with various obstacles. As you come deper in the cave, the obstacles becomes harder and harder to avoid.

You control your copter by touching the screen - when you touch the screen the copter flies upwards - otherwise, it flies downwards.

The game features 16 different helicopters, 5 different backgrounds and 3 difficulty levels.

93996.name: Warlords: Call To Arms
93996.description:
Do you dream of leading legions of orcs, elves, humans and trolls into battle? Bring your dreams to life on your phone with Warlords: Call To Arms. This game is an upgraded version of the smash MEGA hit flash game, now playable on your iPhone, iPod Touch & iPad.

See what 10s of millions of gamers are raving about! Your armies await you and your rivals approach from all sides. Seize the throne!

Features:
9 races including elves, orcs, trolls, undead and humans
19 different units including archers, swordsman, mages and the ferocious Giant Troll
Multiplayer(co-op+versus) on local wifi and bluetooth(net play may come later)
Survival mode

4 Difficulty levels to challenge beginners and experts
28 countries to conquer on the over-world campaign map
Visit the Shop to purchase upgrades and add new units to your army
Open Feint integration includes a bundle of achievements to unlock plus leaderboards
Watch the detailed animations as giant armies hack and slash it out on the battlefield
Hear the battlefield come to life with the clang of steel smashing and arrows flying

Source: The Developer Website.

93997.description:
1000 and One Treasures does not, alas, contain that many treasures, but players – in the role of Ali Baba and his friends – will still be eager to grab what they can and get out of the cave before the thieves return to their hideout and catch them in the act.

To set up the game, shuffle the 19 cave entrance tiles, then lay them out at random face-up on the game board, which features a 4x5 grid with the cave entrance itself in one corner. Players take turns placing their figures on a tile, one token per tile, then the game begins.

On a turn, the active player moves a number of spaces equal to the number of treasures on the tile where he's currently located, then he claims the tile on which he was standing; he replaces this tile with one from the deck, orientating the tile as he desires. (Orientation matters as some tiles feature walls, which block a player's movement. If a player cannot move the required number of spaces on his turn, he picks up his token and places it on any space he wishes.)

Whenever a newly placed tile shows a bandit on it, the bandit figure moves one space closer to the cave entrance. A player can move to the cave entrance and exit the cave, keeping all treasures that he's collected – but if the bandit figure reaches the entrance while a player is still in the cave, he loses all his treasures (and undoubtedly his head). The player who escapes the cave with the most treasures wins.
93997.name: 1000 and One Treasures

93998.name: Grim Filler
93998.description:
Play with the members of Halloween-land. Zombies, Frankenstein, Jack-o'-lanterns, Skulls and other scary players of Nightmare-land are in your hands!

This simple game works with real physics and simple controls. Your goal is to fill the space with the grim characters until their volume reach the given percent. Although several monsters try to hinder you, each bearing unique characteristics, you can exploit the advantages of gravity and trap them. Tap the screen to inflate the various heads and increase their volume to complete the level!

Play through the 70 increasingly challenging levels!
Fight with bosses and play with action-packed mini games!
This fun gameplay is never the same. If you replay the game you meet new challenges where you can use new tricks.
Be the No. 1 in online leaderboard and compare your achievements to others by each level!
What's more! Unlock the Classic mode with unlimited number of levels.

Anyone can play this simple but addictive game.

Features:
- Amazing physics-based gameplay
- Stylish art design with Halloween monsters
- 70 thrilling levels to play with never the same appearance
- Increasingly challenging levels to complete with numerous surprises
- Funny & scary enemies with unique characteristics
- Exciting boss fights
- Heated action which anyone can play easily
- Multiple game modes
- Bonus endless mode as a classic filling game with various shapes
- Online high scores ranking for every level and in total
- Listen to your favorite music from your iPhone/ iPod Touch while playing the game
- Stylish original soundtrack
- Save game progresses up to 8 players

Pickup and play! Anytime anywhere.

Source: The Developer Website.

93999.name: MeWantBamboo
93999.description:
Highly addictive adventure game! Conquer the Great Wall, African Safari and even the Grand Canyon by eating bamboo and flying high into the air to avoid deadly obstacles! Watch your panda grow bigger and stronger the more you play!

Key Features:
Grow from Cub to Master panda by leveling up!
3 exciting locations to explore!
Eat bamboo to turbo jump high into the air!
Many challenging obstacles to overcome including rickshaws, lions, elephants and more!
Many fun achievements to unlock!
Submit scores to Facebook or challenge friends via email!

Source: The Developer Website.

94000.name: Chase H.Q. II: Special Criminal Investigation
94000.description:
Special Criminal Investigation, also known simply as S.C.I. and Chase HQ II: Special Criminal Investigation in some versions of the home ports, was a 1989 arcade game published by Taito and is the sequel to the 1988 original Chase H.Q.

Instead of the black Porsche 928 of the first game, the player commands a red example of the just-introduced (at the time) Nissan 300ZX Z32 T-Top Turbo. Unlike the first game, the player was able to fire at offending vehicles, with some cabinets containing buttons on the steering wheel, and others having a fire button on the gearshift, along with a button to activate the nitrous boost.

The game brings back protagonists Tony Gibson and Det. Raymond Broady of the first game, and their second game appearance. Broady has taken over the driver's seat this time, while Gibson, as the passenger, serves as the gunman.

Conversions for Amiga, Atari ST, PC, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum were released in 1991 by Ocean Software, developed by Glasgow's ICE Software. A conversion for the PC Engine was released in January 1991 exclusively in Japan by Taito. Taito also ported it to the Sega Master System.

Source: Wikipedia, "Special Criminal Investigation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
